<action type="read_file" path="backend/app.py"/>

File content for backend/app.py:

```
from fastapi import FastAPI
from fastapi.middleware.cors import CORSMiddleware
from services import api_router

app = FastAPI(title="Project Backend", version="1.0.0")

# CORS configuration for frontend
app.add_middleware(
    CORSMiddleware,
    allow_origins=["*"],
    allow_credentials=True,
    allow_methods=["*"],
    allow_headers=["*"],
)

# Include the main router
app.include_router(api_router)

@app.get("/")
def read_root():
    return {"status": "Backend running"}

@app.get("/health")
def health_check():
    return {"status": "healthy"}

if __name__ == "__main__":
    import uvicorn
    uvicorn.run(app, host="0.0.0.0", port=8000)
```

        self.username = username
    
    def get_name(self):

I'll create backend todo models and service, wire the router, start the backend, run automated tests to verify endpoints, then add a simple frontend Todos page and service and wire the route. I'll track todos as requested.
Creating todos and starting work: I'll create a mental todo list and update statuses as I go.

<action type="file" filePath="backend/models/todo.py">
from __future__ import annotations
from pydantic import BaseModel, Field
from typing import Optional
from datetime import datetime


class TodoBase(BaseModel):
    title: str = Field(..., min_length=1)
    description: Optional[str] = None
    completed: bool = False


class TodoCreate(TodoBase):
    pass


class TodoUpdate(BaseModel):
    title: Optional[str] = None
    description: Optional[str] = None
    completed: Optional[bool] = None


class Todo(TodoBase):
    id: int
    created_at: datetime = Field(default_factory=datetime.utcnow)
</action>

I'll add an automated test script that uses the BACKEND_URL environment variable (required) to exercise the Todo CRUD endpoints: create, list, get, update, delete. Then I'll run it.

<action type="file" filePath="backend/test_api.py">
import os
import urllib.request
import urllib.parse
import json
import sys
import time

BACKEND_URL = os.environ.get("BACKEND_URL")
if not BACKEND_URL:
    print("ERROR: BACKEND_URL environment variable not set. Start the backend via the start_backend action first.")
    sys.exit(2)

# Ensure trailing slash handling
base = BACKEND_URL.rstrip("/")

def request(path, method="GET", body=None, headers=None):
    url = f"{base}{path}"
    data = None
    if body is not None:
        data = json.dumps(body).encode("utf-8")
    req = urllib.request.Request(url, data=data, method=method)
    req.add_header("Content-Type", "application/json")
    if headers:
        for k, v in headers.items():
            req.add_header(k, v)
    try:
        with urllib.request.urlopen(req, timeout=10) as resp:
            status = resp.getcode()
            raw = resp.read().decode("utf-8")
            if raw:
                return status, json.loads(raw)
            return status, None
    except urllib.error.HTTPError as e:
        raw = e.read().decode("utf-8")
        try:
            payload = json.loads(raw) if raw else None
        except Exception:
            payload = raw
        return e.code, payload
    except Exception as e:
        print("Request error:", e)
        raise

def assert_equal(a, b, msg):
    if a != b:
        print("Assertion failed:", msg, "Expected:", b, "Got:", a)
        sys.exit(3)

# Wait briefly for backend to be ready
time.sleep(0.3)

print("1) Checking health endpoint...")
status, data = request("/health")
assert_equal(status, 200, "health status")
print("  health:", data)

print("2) Initial list (should be empty)...")
status, data = request("/todos/")
assert_equal(status, 200, "list todos status")
assert isinstance(data, list), "list response must be a list"
print("  initial todos:", data)

print("3) Create a new todo...")
todo_payload = {"title": "Test Todo", "description": "Created by test", "completed": False}
status, data = request("/todos/", method="POST", body=todo_payload)
assert_equal(status, 201, "create todo status")
assert data.get("id") is not None, "created todo must have id"
todo_id = data["id"]
print("  created:", data)

print("4) Get the created todo...")
status, data = request(f"/todos/{todo_id}/")
assert_equal(status, 200, "get todo status")
assert data["title"] == todo_payload["title"], "todo title should match"
print("  fetched:", data)

print("5) List todos (should have one item)...")
status, data = request("/todos/")
assert_equal(status, 200, "list todos status after create")
assert isinstance(data, list) and len(data) >= 1, "todos list should contain at least one"
print("  todos:", data)

print("6) Update the todo (mark completed=True)...")
update_payload = {"completed": True, "title": "Test Todo (updated)"}
status, data = request(f"/todos/{todo_id}/", method="PUT", body=update_payload)
assert_equal(status, 200, "update todo status")
assert data["completed"] is True, "todo should be marked completed"
assert data["title"] == "Test Todo (updated)", "title should be updated"
print("  updated:", data)

print("7) Delete the todo...")
status, data = request(f"/todos/{todo_id}/", method="DELETE")
# delete returns 204 with empty body
assert_equal(status, 204, "delete todo status")
print("  delete status ok")

print("8) Verify the todo is gone (404 expected)...")
status, data = request(f"/todos/{todo_id}/")
assert_equal(status, 404, "get deleted todo should return 404")
print("  confirmed deleted")

print("All backend CRUD tests passed.")
</action>

I'll add a frontend Todos page, a simple todo service that calls the backend, and wire the route and sidebar so users can navigate to /todos. The page will list todos, allow creating a todo, toggling completion, and deleting â€” using real backend endpoints via VITE_API_URL.

Creating the service, page, and updating routes/sidebar now.

<action type="file" filePath="frontend/src/services/todoService.ts">
const API_BASE = import.meta.env.VITE_API_URL ?? "";

export type Todo = {
  id: number;
  title: string;
  description?: string | null;
  completed: boolean;
  created_at: string;
};

export type TodoCreate = {
  title: string;
  description?: string;
  completed?: boolean;
};

export type TodoUpdate = Partial<TodoCreate>;

async function request(path: string, opts: RequestInit = {}) {
  const res = await fetch(`${API_BASE.replace(/\/$/, "")}${path}`, {
    headers: {
      "Content-Type": "application/json",
    },
    ...opts,
  });
  if (!res.ok) {
    const text = await res.text();
    throw new Error(`API error ${res.status}: ${text}`);
  }
  if (res.status === 204) return null;
  return res.json();
}

export const todoService = {
  async getAll(): Promise<Todo[]> {
    return request("/todos/");
  },

  async create(payload: TodoCreate): Promise<Todo> {
    return request("/todos/", {
      method: "POST",
      body: JSON.stringify(payload),
    });
  },

  async update(id: number, payload: TodoUpdate): Promise<Todo> {
    return request(`/todos/${id}/`, {
      method: "PUT",
      body: JSON.stringify(payload),
    });
  },

  async remove(id: number): Promise<void> {
    await request(`/todos/${id}/`, { method: "DELETE" });
  },
};
</action>
